intro: Diplacus stellatus, commonly known as starry false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and stream banks. Diplacus stellatus is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants.
